title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 August 2009 - XWiki
content:
npm - (26/08/2009 00:04): last time I tried, "parseGroovyFromPage()" only worked with the document saved as 1.0  
npm - (26/08/2009 00:04): ^^jvdrean  
npm - (26/08/2009 00:04): which is fine, as long as 1.0 doesn't go away in some future version of xwiki  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:09): [jvdrean] from parseGroovyFromPage():  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:09): [jvdrean] return parseGroovyFromString(context.getWiki().getDocument(fullname, context).getContent(), context);  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:09): [glerouge] if xwiki 1.0 syntax were to go away there would be an alternative way for groovy anyway  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:09): [jvdrean] I'm pretty sure the syntax isn't taken into account  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:15): [jvdrean] yep, I've just tried. Don't worry 1.0 won't go away before the next major version  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:37): [glerouge] hi sdumitriu  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:37): [sdumitriu] Hi glerouge  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:37): [glerouge] I've been thinking abotu the behavior of title when there's also a heading 1 in the page  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:37): [glerouge] do we currently use a H1 to display the title on the new skin ?  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:38): [sdumitriu] Yes  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:38): [glerouge] so if there's a title + a h1 in the page (which will happen since the WYSIWYG generates H1) they will look the same  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:38): [sdumitriu] Yes  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:39): [glerouge] should we add a specific rule to the H1 that's also the page title to display it a bit bigger ?  
npm - (26/08/2009 00:39): hmm so i guess the trick re 2.0 syntax and parseGroovyFromPage() is, logically, to use the same exact trick for hiding the markup, e.g. /\* Groovy Class Called by [[ts.Analysis2JSON]] {{velocity filter="none"}} #\* \*/ [[[code here]]] /\* \*# {/velocity}} \*/  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:39): [glerouge] npm: if it worked for you I guess it's the right solution ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:40): [jvdrean] npm: hum no the trick won't work with 2.0  
npm - (26/08/2009 00:40): it just sorta did  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:40): [glerouge] sdumitriu: the filter is gonna look hackish, there are at least 5 different cases  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:41): [glerouge] 1) the page has a title & a header 1 and both are the same 2) the page has a title anda header 1 but they're not the same 3) the page has a title and no header 1 4) the page has no title and a header 1 5) the page has no title nor header 1  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:42): [sdumitriu] But 3 and 5 are OK  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:42): [glerouge] 5) you use the page name as a title I guess ?  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:42): [sdumitriu] Yes  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:42): [sdumitriu] The real problem is that the first heading is not easy to find  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:43): [sdumitriu] At least not with the current API  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:43): [glerouge] for 1) and 4) we would have to "hide" the heading in the content and put it as a title  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:43): [sdumitriu] We could make extractTitle a public API  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:43): [glerouge] and for 2) we need to fix the style somehow I guess  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:43): [jvdrean] npm: right it works, I've read too fast. It would be great to update the groovy class tutorial with info about making it work with xwiki/2.0  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:44): [glerouge] since it's gonna happen regularly  
npm - (26/08/2009 00:44): i guess i can dig the working 2.0 out of the history :-)  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:45): [jvdrean] got to go, bye all  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:45): [glerouge] gn  
npm - (26/08/2009 00:45): thanks for all the help, it's been great jvdrean (and everybody else too)  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:46): [glerouge] npm: our pleasure :-)  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:46): [glerouge] npm: don't forget to fill http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SurveyXWikiFeatures  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:47): [glerouge] ricardo: so you got adium working? ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:48): [Ricardo Rodríguez] glerouge: thanks to your help!  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:49): [Ricardo Rodríguez] it works fine. But only 1.4b9 allowed me to set up the automatic reconnect.  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:49): [glerouge] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:51): [glerouge] npm: you can vote on only part of the stuff ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:53): [glerouge] lol  
npm - (26/08/2009 00:53): { id: "999997\_\_0.0", label: "0.0", type: "EpisodeEvent", value: 3 } { id: "999997\_\_12.6", label: "12.6", type: "EpisodeEvent", value: 7 }  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:53): [glerouge] not sure what that is, but good luck ;)  
npm - (26/08/2009 00:54): part of http://nielsmayer.com/xwiki/bin/view/Exhibit/NPRpods3 :-)  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:58): [glerouge] the UI is a bit confusing at first but the feature set is rather nice  
npm - (26/08/2009 00:59): yep... it's not how it's going to look in end and i stopped working on that to concentrate on the important part...  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 00:59): [glerouge] ok  
npm - (26/08/2009 01:00): when i'm done with what i'm working on, the aforementioned will look different anyways  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:40): [Vincent Massol] does anyone know if thomas is avail today?  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:44): [jvdrean] Vincent Massol: thomas is at a customer but at least for half of the day  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:44): [jvdrean] s/but//  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:44): [Vincent Massol] jvdrean: yep thanks, lucaa has pinged me privately about it  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:49): [Vincent Massol] glerouge: how is http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/UserExperience/ different from the Design space?  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:50): [Vincent Massol] couldn't you have a design item for this?  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:50): [Vincent Massol] (for me the design space was where all our future ideas/work in progress was located)  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:51): [Vincent Massol] not that I mind much to have a UX space, it's just add a bit of complexity imo  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:51): [Vincent Massol] when we create a new desing idea we'll need to know whether it's about UX or not  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:51): [Vincent Massol] and in most cases it's really hard to make the diff  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:51): [Vincent Massol] right now you could move at least 30% of the design ideas in UX  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:51): [Vincent Massol] since a lot are about improving the UX  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:52): [glerouge] if you look at it there are no proposals in the UX space  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:52): [Vincent Massol] that's a pb!  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:52): [Vincent Massol] this is not a fait accompli  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:52): [Vincent Massol] it's a proposal  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:52): [glerouge] it's simply a place where to gather UX-related concepts / ideas  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:52): [Vincent Massol] nobody has agreed  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:52): [Vincent Massol] so it MUST be a proposal  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:52): [Vincent Massol] the design space is labelled "Idea"  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:52): [Vincent Massol] it's for ideas  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:52): [Vincent Massol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:53): [glerouge] I knew you'd have something to say :)  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:53): [Vincent Massol] just trying to keep xwiki.org clean that's all  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:53): [glerouge] ok, here's what I'd like to achieve, let's see what's the best way to reach it  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:53): [glerouge] I'd like us to agree on a set of guidelines / goals when it comes to UX  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:53): [Vincent Massol] ahah  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:54): [glerouge] so that each time we develop new features they remain consistent with one another  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:54): [Vincent Massol] so you want to propose something  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:54): [glerouge] yep  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:54): [Vincent Massol] just create a UX page in design  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:54): [Vincent Massol] and gather all your stories in there  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:54): [Vincent Massol] later on when you're ready  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:54): [Vincent Massol] you propose it  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:54): [Vincent Massol] (ie send it on the list for approval)  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:55): [glerouge] k  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:55): [Vincent Massol] now I'm also fine to have a UX space if that's just to categorize pages (it only depends how many you want to have)  
xwiki-bridge - (26/08/2009 10:55): [Vincent Massol] what I don't like is to introduce a top level notion of UX
